#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Chiayi
#Text=Chiayi
#Text=( 嘉義 ) , also spelled Jiayi , is the main city of Chiayi County , southern Taiwan .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Chiayi City is a laid-back , friendly country town of around 270,000 people and is the access point for trips to the scenic mountain area of Alishan .
#Text=If you are on your way to Alishan , note that it is not necessary to stay in Chiayi , as buses leave quite frequently and the city itself is not particularly interesting .
#Text=By train
#Text=HSR Chiayi ( Taibao ) station is on the high-speed line between Taipei ( 1½ hours , NT$ 1080 ) and Kaohsiung .
#Text=The HSR station is over 15 km out of town , but linked to the city by the Chiayi BRT system .
#Text=Chiayi is also served by mainline TRA trains and the scenic narrow-gauge Alishan Forest Railway
#Text=to Alishan , which both leave from the same station , but have separate ticketing counters .

#Text=Long-distance buses leave from the terminal immediately outside the station , but local buses ( notably those to nearby hot spring town Guanzihling ) use the Zhongshan Rd bus terminal a few hundred meters down the street .
#Text=The Alishan Forest Railway was severely damaged by Typhoon Morakot in 2009 .
#Text=As of January 2015 , the train runs from Chiayi to Fencihu only , with the remainder of the line still closed for repairs .
#Text=The local lines within the recreation area are operating normally .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Chiayi Airport
#Text=( CYI ) .
#Text=Uni Air from Kinmen and Penghu .
#Text=Get around
#Text=The Chiayi Bus Rapid Transit ( BRT ) system has three lines , with the main line linking the HSR and TRA railway stations .

#Text=The trip between the two takes around 30 minutes ( NT$ 40 , exact change - no charge if going directly between the HSR & TRA stations ) , but note that the BRT stop is on the rear side of the TRA station , so you need to take the pedestrian bridge to cross to the other side .
#Text=The location of the TRA station is not obvious from the BRT stop .
#Text=If coming from the direction of the HSR railway , after you get off at the stop , cross to the other side of the street at the intersection you have just passed .
#Text=The " back station " area is still under construction - bear to the right and you should find the pedestrian bridge .

#Text=If coming from the TRA station , go to the far left when facing the station from the outside ( past the taxi queue ) and you will find signs and a pedestrian bridge upstairs that leads to some patchy BRT signs - BRT is on the ground floor , usually bus terminal 1 ( likely to be a queue of other people ) for a free ride to the HSR station .
#Text=Buses have announcements and signage in English as well as Chinese .
#Text=Taxis are plentiful , especially around the train stations , and some pidgin English is spoken .
#Text=Buses to Alisan cost about NT$ 236 - 250 one way , and can be bought at the bus station next to the train station .
#Text=The ride takes 2-2½ hours .
#Text=There are also some gypsy cabs that will drive you to Alisan , too .
#Text=See
#Text=The best way to get to know Chiayi is to take a walk down Culture Road , and not just once but a few times , back and forth .
#Text=There are also two movie theaters where you can experience watching both Western movies and Chinese-language movies in a theater packed with local Taiwanese viewers , young and old .
#Text=There is a good bookstore called Hon-too Bookstore with a wide range of English-language magazines which you can peruse at your leisure .
#Text=For some quiet downtime , Chiayi Park and Botanical Gardens are a lovely way to spend the afternoon .
#Text=The Botanical Gardens provide pleasant trails that weave you through a large variety of plants and trees native to the area .
#Text=Ponds hold Japanese koi fish , turtles , and frogs .
#Text=Chiayi park is well-maintained and serves as a center of activity for local adults — and senior citizens — and children from 5 am to late in the afternoon .
#Text=Do
#Text=Do visit the 1931 Kano baseball museum , which houses old photographs of the famous Chiayi high school team from 1931 .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Culture Road ( site of the " Wunhua Rd Night Market " , see below ) is Chiayi 's main shopping street .
#Text=Another shopping street , but more commercial and less cool , is Zhongshan Road ( 中山路 ) which stretches from the main train station to a roundabout public fountain area at Culture Road .
#Text=One specialty chain store that 's located on Zhongshang Road is the " Guang Nan " ( 光南 ) , which sells small electronics and other media-related goods .
#Text=Catch a good deal on cables and computer accessories here , along with VCDs of Taiwan dramas/Japanese anime/American films ( subtitled in traditional Chinese ) .
#Text=There are two night markets in Chiayi , but the most famous and the best is the Culture Road night market .
#Text=The other night market , also fun and tasty , is the Carrefour Night Market next to the Carrefour store along Bo Ai Road .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Chiayi is famous in Taiwan and among tourists for its popular chicken rice ( 鶏肉飯 ) , a popular dish of chicken [ or turkey ] strips and a savory sauce ladled over the white rice .
#Text=Most people call it " chicken rice , " as above , but it 's really turkey meat .
#Text=It 's available at many sidewalk shops and indoor eateries around town , NT$ 20 - 40 .
#Text=Fountain Turkey Rice
#Text=( 噴水鶏肉飯 ) , 325 Zhongshan Rd ( 中山路325號 ) .
#Text=One of the most popular chicken rice joints in town , with a number of franchises .
#Text=But the shop on Culture Road , around the corner , is the most famous -- and crowded . $ 50 - 100 .
#Text=Carrefour Night Market

#Text=( 嘉樂福觀光夜市 ) along Bo Ai Rd near the Carrefour store offers a tasty variety of Taiwanese food dishes , and you can sometimes spot foreigners busking , juggling , miming or selling their Chinese-language books there .
#Text=The barbeque stall at the entrance is a must-try , as is almost every other stall in the market .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Chiayi has many roadside tea shops and quite a few karaoke lounges , and a few pubs and bars , too .
#Text=Cha-no-Michi
#Text=( 茶の道 ) , Zhongshan Rd 505-1 .

#Text=Pleasant little modern tea shop right next to the Zhongshan Rd bus terminal , offering up a vast range of yummy Taiwanese drinks like milk tea with pudding chunks ( 布丁奶茶 ) and more traditional fruit juices .
#Text=NT$ 15 - 40 .
